result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey Meadows Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rickey Meadows Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rickey Meadows Jr. was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside without Court's permission.  May not have contact with Victim.  Not to reside with anyone of the opposite sex without Court's permission.  While on probation, DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

records.addlTxt:
Minutes:  15CF1188/16CF257.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

15CF1188 - deft sentenced to 5yrs WSP; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 167 days.  

16CF257 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 2yrs consecutive to 15CF1188.  Probation conditions to be identical to those of ES.

DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgement.

NOTE - after conclusion of hrg, comments were made by two spectators.  One spectator, Katherine Wysocki, was using foul language while exiting the courtroom.  Ms. Wysocki was brought back into the courtroom; she was found in contempt by the Court.  Discussion held.  Ms. Wysocki was given a verbal warning this time.

Minutes:  15CF1188/16CF257.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

15CF1188 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

16CF257 - deft pleads guilty to count 4; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/8/16 @ 11am

***  $1500.00 CASH ALREADY ON DEPOSIT - ADDITIONAL $6500.00 NEEDS TO BE POSTED  ***
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No contact with Tracey M, Katherine W, or their residences.
940.235(1) - Strangulation & Suffocation, DV, Repeater   940.19(1) - Battery, DV, Repeater   947.01(1) - DC/DV, Repeater  2cts.   940.45(3) - Felony Intimidation of a Victim, DV, Repeater   943.14 - Criminal Trespass, DV, Repeater

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Mutual request for an adjournment; deft has new file in the system - similar charges with the same complaining witness.  FPT adj to 5/26/16 @ 10am, JS 6/13/16 @ 9am.  Defense moves to remove no contact order w/Katherine W who is not the complaining witness; State objects.  Arguments heard.  Motion to lift no contact order with Katherine W is denied.  Court amends deft's bond to $8,000 cash; with same conditions as previously imposed.  NOTE - deft has $1500 cash posted; needs add'l $6500 cash to meet the new bond amount.
Time of FPT for 3/16/16 moved from 9:30am to 9am due to jury trial
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
FPT moved to 3/16/16 @ 9:30am on request of defense counsel with no objection by ADA Krejcarek per email
